dial.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the round part of a clock, watch, machine etc that has numbers that show you the time or a measurement
dial.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The lighted dial of her watch said 1.20.
She looked at the dial to check her speed.
dial.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the part of a piece of equipment such as a radio or thermostat that you turn around to do something, such as find a different station or change the temperature
dial.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The dial on the heater was set to ‘HOT’.
dial.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the wheel on an older telephone with numbered holes for your fingers that you move around in order to make a call
dial.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call
dial.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I think I dialed the wrong number.
dial.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a type of soap used for washing the body and face, sold in the US
